required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: The Effect of Tocilizumab on Procalcitonin and Other Biochemical and Clinical Markers in the Setting of COVID-19 Pneumonia
clinical_study.official_title: The Effect of Tocilizumab on Procalcitonin and Other Biochemical and Clinical Markers in the Setting of COVID-19 Pneumonia

brief_summary.textblock: This study aims to establish whether tocilizumab has any significant effect on procalcitonin levels on patients diagnosed with COVID-19 pneumonia requiring intensive care admission. The effects on other biochemical and clinical markers are also considered.

detailed_description.textblock:
A retrospective study, involving the first fifty patients treated with tocilizumab for acute deterioration in COVID-19 pneumonia in the Intensive Care Unit (ICU) at Mater Dei Hospital in Malta.
The following parameters will be collected from medical records:
- procalcitonin levels, daily for twenty days or until discharge or death.
- namely white cell count (WCC), neutrophils, lymphocytes,
- C-reactive protein (CRP)
- PaO2/FiO2 ratio (P/F ratio).
This group will be compared to a control group was chosen from patients admitted to the ICU who were not eligible for tocilizumab treatment, matched to the study group for age, gender, mode of ventilation required and length of stay in ICU.

primary_outcome.time_frame: throughout study completion, daily for maximum of 20 days
primary_outcome.description: effect of Tocilizumab on Procalcitonin levels

secondary_outcome.time_frame: throughout study completion, daily for maximum of 20 days
secondary_outcome.description: effect of Tocilizumab on CRP levels

secondary_outcome.time_frame: throughout study completion, daily for maximum of 20 days
secondary_outcome.description: effect of Tocilizumab on WCC levels

secondary_outcome.time_frame: throughout study completion, daily for maximum of 20 days
secondary_outcome.description: effect of Tocilizumab on Neutrophils levels

secondary_outcome.time_frame: throughout study completion, daily for maximum of 20 days
secondary_outcome.description: effect of Tocilizumab on Lymphocytes levels

secondary_outcome.time_frame: throughout study completion, daily for maximum of 20 days
secondary_outcome.description: effect of Tocilizumab on Neutrophil to Lymphocyte ratio

secondary_outcome.time_frame: throughout study completion, daily for maximum of 20 days
secondary_outcome.description: effect of Tocilizumab on P/F ratio

arm_group.description: The first 50 patients admitted to the ITU at Mater Dei Hospital with COVID-19 Pneumonia, to whom tocilizumab was administered
50 patients admitted to ITU at Mater Dei Hospital with COVID-19 Pneumonia, who did not receive Tocilizumab

intervention.description: Tocilizumab administered at a dose of 8mg/kg up to a maximum of 800mg

study_pop.textblock: COVID-19 patients treated with tocilizumab single dose therapy in ICU

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Confirmed COVID-19 diagnosis
- Admitted to ITU
- Tocilizumab treatment
Exclusion Criteria:
- none
